document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Bidessus from Anjozorobe-Angavo and a review of Malagasy Bidessus (Coleoptera, Dytiscidae)

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4. Distribution maps of the Malagasy species of
Bidessus Sharp, 1882
. A .
B. longistriga Régimbart, 1895
. B .
B. perexiguus Kolbe, 1883
. C .
B. cf. nero Gschwendtner, 1933
(circle),
B. nesioticus Guignot, 1956
(square),
B. anjozorobe
sp. nov. (triangle). D .
B. apicidens Biström & Sanfilippo, 1986
(square),
B. cf. ceratus Guignot, 1941
(circle).

subSubSection.paragraph: On Madagascar found at elevations between 900–1700 m a.s.l. The localities are characterized by being vegetation-rich stagnant waters, a pool next to a river, a pond/marsh and small lake with floating vegetation edges. Semi-open to open landscapes.

Further study on molecular level may reveal that
B. cf. nero
in Madagascar is in fact a separate species.
